data.text:
According to the Brittanica Dictionary, the word “bridge” can have various meanings. The one that came to mind immediately when I read what this month’s challenge would be about, is the most obvious:

A structure built over something (such as a river) so that people or vehicles can get across.

My header image (a photograph that I took in China, during a trip more than ten years ago) is clearly in that category, as will many others be.

But I would also want to use Britannica’s second definition of the word:

Something that joins or connects different people or things.

That same header image is also a symbol connecting different concepts. If it looks vaguely familiar to you, it’s because a photograph of that same bridge has been used by Microsoft as one of its Windows screensaver images. A very modern concept. And yet, its clearly a relatively old structure, in a very traditional setting.

But let’s move onto the African continent and some memorable bridges or “bridges” that I’ve experienced, over the years.
